sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• Idiopathic constipation, chronic: 145 mcg ORALLY once daily at least 30 minutes prior to the first meal of the day
  • Irritable bowel syndrome characterized by constipation: 290 mcg ORALLY once daily at least 30 minutes prior to first meal of the day

sub.mono:

  • hepatic impairment: no dose adjustment necessary

2.title: Black Box Warning
2.mono:
Oral (Capsule)
Linaclotide is contraindicated in pediatric patients up to 6 years of age. Avoid use in pediatric patients 6 through 17 years of age. Linaclotide has caused deaths in young juvenile mice due to dehydration at clinically relevant adult doses.

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• known or suspected mechanical gastrointestinal obstruction
  • pediatric patients up to 6 years of age

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:

  • -- avoid use in pediatric patients aged 6 to 17 years
  • Gastrointestinal:

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Gastrointestinal:Abdominal distension (2% to 3%), Abdominal pain (7%), Diarrhea (16% to 20%), Flatulence (4% to 6%)
Serious
Gastrointestinal:Diarrhea (Severe) (2%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Linaclotide is a guanylate cyclase-C (GC-C) agonist. Linaclotide and the active metabolite bind to GC-C of the luminal surface of intestinal epithelium. Binding of linaclotide and the active metabolite activates GC-C, which in turn, increases intracellular and extracellular levels of cyclic guanosine monophosphate (cGMP). Elevated intracellular cGMP stimulates the secretion of chloride and bicarbonate into the intestinal lumen, causing an increase in intestinal fluid and faster transit.

2.mono:
• Gastrointestinal tract: primary route
  • Principal peptide metabolite: active

9.mono:
Oral
  • administer 30 minutes prior to first meal of the day

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Instruct patient to not allow children under 18 years of age access to the drug, as harm may result if they take the drug.
  • This drug may cause diarrhea, abdominal pain, flatulence, abdominal distension, or headache.
  • Instruct patient to report severe diarrhea, especially if accompanied by hematochezia or melena.
  • Patient should swallow capsule whole once daily on an empty stomach at least 30 minutes before the first meal of the day.
